F1 24 is incredibly fun, especially when playing Team Career with friends. There’s something really satisfying about working together, chasing podiums, and sharing those intense race moments. It genuinely helps me release stress and just enjoy the thrill of racing without overthinking anything.

A perfect mix of teamwork, adrenaline, and pure fun.

My experience with F1 24 is that it truly excels by elevating the game far beyond a simple racer, focusing heavily on the strategic simulation that I really enjoy. For me, the revamped Driver Career mode is the heart of this. I found myself plunged into the role of a driver managing not just on-track rivalries but also secret contract negotiations and a specialist R&D team, which makes car development a critical long-term strategy. This depth extends right onto the track, where I learned my success hinges on more than just the racing line; I have to actively manage the new ERS modes and a more comprehensive tire wear model, turning each Grand Prix into a dynamic puzzle of resource management. The game perfectly strikes that difficult-to-achieve balance between arcade and realism. While I know some sim racers find the new Dynamic Handling a bit forgiving, I found this accessibility is precisely what makes the game so enjoyable. It allows me to feel the thrill and strategic pressure of an F1 driver without the punishing difficulty of a pure simulation.

I wanted to love it, but most of the time I just ended up frustrated.

The handling is utter dog crap.
Cars feel very sharp and unpredictable, sometimes it feels like they can't decide whether they have grip or not. Fast corners especially feel very weird, and instead of learning the car, I always felt like I was just trying to survive it.

Physics feel inconsistent.
Tyre wear, traction, even aerodynamics — none of it seems to behave logically. One lap I feel planted, the next I'm sliding everywhere, even when I drove the same way. It made me feel like I wasn’t racing, but gambling.

AI behavior is erratic.
Sometimes too aggressive, punting me off in corners, other times so slow it felt like easy mode. Probably the worst AI I have ever seen in an F1 game.

The game's just rushed and shallow. 
I haven't played F1 23, but compared to other ones (2018, 2019, 2022), there weren’t any big new features — just changes to handling and physics that honestly made the game worse. It didn’t feel like a full new release, more like an experimental patch that got sold as a full game.

However, it does looks amazing.
 The cars and tracks are gorgeous, and the replays make it feel like you’re watching a real F1 broadcast. Sometimes I’d finish a race, watch the highlights, and think “wow, this game is stunning”… before remembering how awful the handling felt getting there.

Tyre wear, traction, even aerodynamics — none of it seems to behave logically. One lap I feel planted, the next I'm sliding everywhere, even when I drove the same way. It made me feel like I wasn’t racing, but gambling.

AI behavior is erratic.
Sometimes too aggressive, punting me off in corners, other times so slow it felt like easy mode. Probably the worst AI I have ever seen in an F1 game.

The game's just rushed and shallow. 
I haven't played F1 23, but compared to other ones (2018, 2019, 2022), there weren’t any big new features — just changes to handling and physics that honestly made the game worse. It didn’t feel like a full new release, more like an experimental patch that got sold as a full game.

However, it does looks amazing.
 The cars and tracks are gorgeous, and the replays make it feel like you’re watching a real F1 broadcast. Sometimes I’d finish a race, watch the highlights, and think “wow, this game is stunning”… before remembering how awful the handling felt getting there.

I should've waited for F1 25
